intro: Anethum capense, commonly known as wild cumin, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley, carrots, and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Anethum capense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
